original: @58a * // bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: @58a * // bcom ldan 'das rdo rje rnam par 'joms pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Blessed One, Vajramahābala.

original: rig sngags kyi las chud mi za bar byed pa'i sgrub pa po dam tshig dang ldan pas bum pa gcig pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhengs la /
analyzed: rig sngags kyi las chud mi za bar byed pa'i sgrub pa po dam tshig dang ldan pas bum pa gcig pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhengs la /
translated: The practitioner who is faithful to the commitments, in order to ensure that the activity of the knowledge-mantra is not wasted, should erect the maṇḍala of the single vase.

original: de la ci 'dod pa'i dbang bskur blangs la bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas thams cad la thugs gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rnams bdag la bltas te /
analyzed: de la ci 'dod pa'i dbang bskur blangs la bdag nyid kyis sangs rgyas thams cad la thugs gnyis su med pa'i ye shes rnams bdag la bltas te /
translated: Having received the empowerment of whatever is desired, one should visualize all buddhas as the wisdom of the non-dual mind, looking upon oneself.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dbyibs rnams bdag la bstims la /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dbyibs rnams bdag la bstims la /
translated: The forms of their body, speech, and mind should be absorbed into oneself.

original: de nas rang 'dod pa'i lhar dmigs la bsnyen pa 'bum phrag gcig bsgrub pa la 'bum phrag gnyis byas la mchod pa bdag nyid kyis bdag la mchod pa dang / de bzhin du bstod pa dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / bskul ba dang /
analyzed: de nas rang 'dod pa'i lhar dmigs la bsnyen pa 'bum phrag gcig bsgrub pa la 'bum phrag gnyis byas la mchod pa bdag nyid kyis bdag la mchod pa dang / de bzhin du bstod pa dang / gsol ba gdab pa dang / bskul ba dang /
translated: Then, visualizing oneself as the desired deity, one should accomplish the approach of one hundred thousand [recitations], and for the accomplishment, two hundred thousand [recitations]. One should make offerings to oneself, praise oneself, make supplications to oneself, exhort oneself,

original: rjes su yi rang ba dang / bdag dang sems can gyi don rjes su gzung ba rnams bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba dang / bdag dang sems can gyi don rjes su gzung ba rnams bya ste /
translated: rejoice, and take care of oneself and sentient beings.

original: bum pa'i nang nas kyang mchod pa'i lha mo grangs med pa rnams spros la bdag la mchod pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa mdun gyi nam mkha' la spyan drangs la bdag la rjes su yi rangs shing bstod pa dang /
analyzed: bum pa'i nang nas kyang mchod pa'i lha mo grangs med pa rnams spros la bdag la mchod pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dpag tu med pa mdun gyi nam mkha' la spyan drangs la bdag la rjes su yi rangs shing bstod pa dang /
translated: Countless buddhas and bodhisattvas are invited into the space in front and rejoice and praise oneself.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i mkha' 'gro ma grangs med pa rnams kyis kyang bdag gi zhabs spyi gtsug tu len cing /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gzugs 'dzin pa'i mkha' 'gro ma grangs med pa rnams kyis kyang bdag gi zhabs spyi gtsug tu len cing /
translated: Countless dakinis who take on supramundane forms also lift one’s feet to the crown of their heads.

original: rab tu bstod pa dang 'jig rten la gnas shing @58b 'jig rten skyong ba'i lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang bdag la mthu dang gzi brjid dang / dpal 'jug pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang sprul pa'i gzugs grangs med pa sprul te /
analyzed: rab tu bstod pa dang 'jig rten la gnas shing @58b 'jig rten skyong ba'i lha dang klu dang gnod sbyin dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang bdag la mthu dang gzi brjid dang / dpal 'jug pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang sprul pa'i gzugs grangs med pa sprul te /
translated: They praise one greatly. Also, gods, nagas, yakshas, Brahma, and so on, who abide in the world and protect the world, enter one’s power, splendor, and glory.

original: rdzu 'phrul byin cing ngo mtshar gyi tshogs bshad pa mang por brjod par dmigs la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul byin cing ngo mtshar gyi tshogs bshad pa mang por brjod par dmigs la /
translated: Visualize that they bestow miracles and explain many wondrous assemblies.

original: khams gsum na ji ltar dmigs pa'i mthu rtsal dang / longs spyod pa dang / dpal dang / dge ba dang / stobs dang / gzi brjid dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa dang bdag ldan par dmigs pa dang / 'das pa'i ye shes dang thams cad mkhyen pa dang de bzhin nyid dang zag pa med pa'i chos nyid thams cad bdag nyid yin par dmigs so //
analyzed: khams gsum na ji ltar dmigs pa'i mthu rtsal dang / longs spyod pa dang / dpal dang / dge ba dang / stobs dang / gzi brjid dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa dang bdag ldan par dmigs pa dang / 'das pa'i ye shes dang thams cad mkhyen pa dang de bzhin nyid dang zag pa med pa'i chos nyid thams cad bdag nyid yin par dmigs so //
translated: Visualize that you possess the power, resources, glory, virtue, strength, splendor, sovereignty, and so forth of whatever is observed in the three realms, and that you are the very embodiment of the wisdom of the past, omniscience, suchness, and the entire incorruptible reality.

original: de ltar dmigs pa la rgyud rdzogs par klag pa tshar re zhing rang gi 'dod pa'i gtso bo'i dngos grub lan re blangs te /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa la rgyud rdzogs par klag pa tshar re zhing rang gi 'dod pa'i gtso bo'i dngos grub lan re blangs te /
translated: In this way, read the entire tantra once, and each time you do so, take up the principal spiritual power that you desire.

original: khams gsum gyi bcud bsdus 'das pa'i dpal bsdu'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi bcud bsdus 'das pa'i dpal bsdu'o //
translated: Gather the vitality of the three realms and the glory of the past.

original: de lta bu lan brgya rtsa brgyad byas pas rig sngags sam /
analyzed: de lta bu lan brgya rtsa brgyad byas pas rig sngags sam /
translated: Do this one hundred and eight times, and you will master the awareness mantras.

original: gsang sngags kyi 'dod pa'i don gcig 'grub pas lhag ma ma lus par 'grub cing de nyid la zag pa med par longs spyod par nges so //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi 'dod pa'i don gcig 'grub pas lhag ma ma lus par 'grub cing de nyid la zag pa med par longs spyod par nges so //
translated: Since the one desired object of the secret mantra is accomplished, the rest is accomplished without remainder, and one definitely enjoys that without outflows.

original: gzungs sngags kyi las grub pa rnams chud mi za bar byed pa rin po che'i gter sgrub ces bya ba /
analyzed: gzungs sngags kyi las grub pa rnams chud mi za bar byed pa rin po che'i gter sgrub ces bya ba /
translated: The accomplishment of the activities of the dharani mantra is called accomplishing the precious treasure that prevents waste.

original: slob dpon ye shes rdo rjes mdzad pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: slob dpon ye shes rdo rjes mdzad pa rdzogs so//
translated: It was composed by the master Yesha Dorje.
